snippet: Tough new Kremlin measures against protests may have emboldened rather than deterred critics of the president.
abstract: Tens of thousands of protesters throng central Moscow, voicing renewed fury at Pres Vladimir V Putin and defying recent efforts by his government to clamp down on the political opposition movement; large turnout suggests that the tough new posture adopted by the Kremlin against the protests is emboldening rather than deterring Mr. Putin’s critics.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer, Andrew Roth and Anna Kordunsky contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Tough new Kremlin measures against protests may have emboldened rather than deterred critics of the president.

headline.seo: Protesters Defy Efforts to Muffle Anti-Putin Outcry
headline.main: Large Anti-Putin Protest Signals Growing Resolve
headline.print_headline: Large Anti-Putin Protest Signals Growing Resolve
